item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, January 16, 2025 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Nepenthes is a tarpit to catch AI web crawlers (62 points | 29 comments)
2. No Calls (29 points | 1 comment)
3. Nokia's internal presentation after iPhone was launched (2007) [pdf] (226 points | 180 comments)

6. Understanding Memory Management, Part 1: C (80 points | 24 comments)

14. 100x defect tolerance: How we solved the yield problem (286 points | 153 comments)
15. Blue Origin reaches orbit on first flight of its titanic New Glenn rocket (199 points | 129 comments)
16. Is there such a thing as a web-safe font? (23 points | 29 comments)

20. I have made the decision to disband Hindenburg Research (649 points | 325 comments)

22. Why is Cloudflare Pages' bandwidth unlimited? (551 points | 334 comments)
23. dnSpyEx: .NET debugger and assembly editor (174 points | 23 comments)
24. Why the weak nuclear force is short range (350 points | 174 comments)
25. Lambda Calculus in 383 Bytes (2022) (294 points | 47 comments)
26. Titans: Learning to Memorize at Test Time (95 points | 11 comments)
27. Ropey – A UTF8 text rope for manipulating and editing large text (236 points | 97 comments)
28. Qantas South Africa flights delayed by falling debris from SpaceX rockets (110 points | 107 comments)
29. Apache DataFusion (136 points | 35 comments)
30. Red Hat Woos VMware Shops with OpenShift Virtualization Engine (4 points | discuss)
